snippet: The way we fund their benefits makes it too easy to go to war.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Cato Institute scholars Michael F Cannon and Christopher Preble contends Department of Veteran Affairs helps inflict great harm on veterans, active-duty military personnel and civilians due to the way it is funded; notes veterans' benefits are typically funded 40 or 50 years after military conflicts end, and suggests this makes it too easy to go to war; proposes system of veterans' benefits to be funded by Congress in advance.

byline.original: By MICHAEL F. CANNON and CHRISTOPHER A. PREBLE

lead_paragraph: The way we fund their benefits makes it too easy to go to war.
